thread.title: Weekend Watch: Must-see matches from around the world
thread.title_full: Weekend Watch: Must-see matches from around the world | The Seattle Times

author: Matt Pentz
title: Weekend Watch: Must-see matches from around the world
text:
The Confederations Cup playoff to end all Confederations Cup playoffs headlines this weekend’s international edition of the Watch.
Czech Republic vs. Turkey, European Championship qualifying, Saturday at 11:45 a.m. PST 
The Czechs have already qualified for next year’s tournament in France, and thus might be inclined to ease of the pedal. Turkey is desperate to hold off a Netherlands team currently on the outside looking in.
United States U-23s vs. Honduras U-23s, CONCACAF Olympic qualifying, Saturday at 12 p.m. 
Most Read Stories Expect traffic delays when Obama visits Seattle Friday afternoon Huskies upset USC 17-12 and beat Steve Sarkisian, their former coach Win over USC puts UW’s coaching upgrade (Chris Petersen over Steve Sarkisian) on full display Lloyd McClendon will not return as Mariners' manager Even in death, 'Up' house owner Edith Macefield remains a mystery Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. The Fightin’ Jordan Morris’ can qualify for next summer’s Olympic Games in Brazil with a semifinal win at Rio Tinto Stadium. A loss, and the U-23s face off with the Mexico-Canada loser just for the right to take on Colombia for the final berth.
United States vs. Mexico, CONCACAF Confederations Cup playoff, Saturday at 6:30 p.m. 
Yes, this event is a bit contrived, an out-of-thin-air playoff to decide who qualifies for an exhibition tournament two summers from now. And no, Jurgen Klinsmann isn’t getting fired if the USMNT loses. But make no mistake, both teams have bought into the hype, and the months of preparation have added extra spice to a rivalry with plenty of heat to begin with. United States-Mexico, with something tangible on the line — just sit back and enjoy.
Malawi vs. Tanzania, CAF World Cup qualifying, Sunday at 5 a.m. 
Africa boasts one of the world’s most difficult World Cup qualifying structures, series of hurdles that culminates in a loser-out home-and-home to divvy up the confederation’s five berths. One of this two squads will stumble right out of the gate, with the visiting Tanzanians bringing along a 2-0 advantage from the first leg.
Poland vs. Republic of Ireland, European Championship qualifying, Sunday at 11:45 a.m. 
Another headliner, the stakes couldn’t be clearer for the Group D finale in Warsaw. A Poland draw or win, and it automatically qualifies and dumps Ireland into the playoff round. An Irish victory, and Poland has to play for its live. Two teams in good form with plenty on the line.
Ukraine vs. Spain, European Championship qualifying, Monday at 11:45 a.m. 
The Ukrainians are hoping for a couple of breaks on Monday: That Spain, having already qualified, will bring a less-than-full-strength lineup to Kiev, and that Slovakia somehow drops points at little Luxembourg.
Plus a cheat sheet for the loaded slate of upcoming midweek matches: Saudi Arabia at Palestine (Tuesday at 9 a.m.), Czech Republic at Netherlands (Tuesday at 11:45 a.m.), Iceland at Turkey (Tuesday at 11:45 a.m.), Israel at Belgium (Tuesday at 11:45 a.m.), Colombia at Uruguay (Tuesday at 4 p.m.), Argentina at Paraguay (Tuesday at 5 p.m.). 
Matt Pentz : 206-464-3184 or mpentz@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @mattpentz . Matt Pentz covers Sounders FC, Reign FC, MLS and world soccer for The Seattle Times throughout the year.
